intro: Cnicus hispanicus, commonly known as Spanish sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are broad and lobed, with a rough texture, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The species is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
